pull.title: Test CHECKMULTISIG with m == 0 and/or n == 0
pull.body: Turns out that's valid, and we don't test it.

events.message: Test CHECKMULTISIG with m == 0 and n == 0

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/d3a33fc869d23fb13c010a6e9995bdf6574a621e for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
Can we get this merged? Writing more tests and it's annoying not having this in master.

Well, it looks fine to me, just a bit surprised that no one else has reviewed it in all that time.
@thebluematt @mikehearn as this test data is used by BitcoinJ as well, can you have a look here?
Yeah, tests aren't sexy. Used in python-bitcoinlib too now.

Sorry, I didn't review it because I didn't know about it. At-mentioning me to get a review is definitely the right thing to do!

The code looks fine and I took the json files and ran them through bitcoinj, and they passed. So it all LGTM. Please merge.
